title: India jewellery ad starring trans model wins hearts
description: The ad is being praised in India where popular culture still portrays transgender people as caricatures.

title: Esports: Why are there so few professional women gamers?
description: There are no female players in the top 300 earners in esports, according to research shared with BBC News.

title: 'Young, black people have to work three times as hard'
description: This week sees the launch of a programme making high-flying careers more accessible.

title: Why coders love the AI that could put them out of a job
description: Artificial intelligence is getting better at penning code but still a long way from working alone.

title: Recycling: How do you transform old PPE into something new?
description: Turning millions of disposable masks and medical waste into new items is one firm's new mission.

title: England v India highlights: Tourists seal fourth Test victory with superb bowling display
description: England's batting folds under an inspired spell of bowling from India, who sweep to a 157-run victory on the final day at The Oval to take a 2-1 lead in the series.

title: The Taliban embrace social media: 'We too want to change perceptions'
description: Famed for their shunning of technology, the Taliban are realising they need to be on social media too.

title: Inside Big Ben's restoration as it nears finish
description: The restoration of Elizabeth Tower, which will ultimately cost at least £80 million, draws to a close.

title: 'Why not have festivals that only women can attend?'
description: The idea for the three-day LBTQ Femme Fest was conceived on social media during lockdown.

title: Social care reform plans facing Tory tax backlash
description: The PM is in talks on how to fund changes, but Conservative MPs warn against a National Insurance hike.

title: Former France player Adams dies after 39 years in coma
description: Former France footballer Jean-Pierre Adams, who had been in a coma for 39 years, has died at the age of 73.

title: Critics largely lavish praise on Dune remake
description: The blockbuster had its world premiere at the Venice International Film Festival over the weekend.

title: England v India: Rory Burns caught behind for 50 as tourists make breakthrough
description: Rory Burns is caught behind off Shardul Thakur for 50 as India make the breakthrough, reducing England to 100-1 as they chase 368 to win the fourth Test at The Oval.

title: Sarah Harding: Girls Aloud stars lead tributes to singer
description: The singer died from cancer on Sunday aged 39, her mother confirmed on Instagram.

title: Afghanistan: Boris Johnson to face MPs over handling of crisis
description: Boris Johnson will vow to use "every economic, political and diplomatic lever" to help Afghans.

title: Afghanistan: Minister apologises over 'inaccurate' veteran suicide claim
description: James Heappey corrects himself after mistakenly saying a British Afghan veteran had taken their own life.

title: Shropshire baby deaths: Hospital dismissed mum's fears
description: Charlotte Jackson's son died after she reported fluid loss to staff at an under-fire hospital trust.

title: NI Protocol: Further delay expected for Irish Sea border checks
description: An EU source says an announcement on grace periods for some products is likely on Tuesday.

title: Reports of sex abuse between children double in two years
description: Reports of children sexually abusing other children double in two years, BBC Panorama finds.

title: Spider season: Why your home might feel full of arachnids right now
description: They're not coming through the windows - they were already inside.

title: Australian boy, 3, rescued after four days lost in bush
description: Anthony "AJ" Elfalak was spotted by a helicopter, drinking water from a creek near his home.

title: Frozen eggs and sperm storage limit increased to 55 years
description: The health secretary says it "will help turn off the ticking clock in the back of people's minds".

title: Sarah Harding: She was always going at 100mph
description: The team behind Girls Aloud's biggest hits remember Sarah Harding who's died at the age of 39.

title: 'I've raised £100,000 after 24 years of coffee mornings'
description: Eleanor Moffat has spent more than 20 years organising charity events after her sister was diagnosed with cancer.

title: Twins conjoined at head separated after rare surgery in Israel
description: The one-year-old girls are said to be recovering well after the 12-hour operation in Israel.
